In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Sure, here is a function `wrap_string` that takes a string `text` and wraps it to a maximum width of `text_width` characters, defaulting to 10 if no value is provided. It also takes an optional argument `indent` which specifies the number of spaces to indent each line of the wrapped string.
```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString; text_width::Int=10, indent::Int=0)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped = ""
    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            wrapped *= current_line * "\n" * string(" " ^ indent)
            current_line = ""
        end
        current_line *= word * " "
    end
    wrapped *= current_line
    return wrapped
end
```
